title: (x) Looking for typeface similar to Dolly - various {gang}
content:
Hy,

For some weeks I'm looking for a robust text face look like Dolly but less curvy, a little more agressive, a bit more literary.  
[article about dolly: http://www.creativepro.com/story/feature/21831.html]

I want to replace fournier I´m using on this technology and art magazine - [www.nada.com.pt](http://web.archive.org/web/20150308211524/http:/www.nada.com.pt/ "www.nada.com.pt")  
Fournier is too light and it has some problems.  
Dolly its almost what I want...

thank you,  
granjam
author: granjam

comments.content: Check out [Fedra](http://web.archive.org/web/20150308211524/http:/www.typotheque.com/site/fonts.php?id=6) and [Arnhem](http://web.archive.org/web/20150308211524/http:/www.ourtype.be/). They've got that Dutch dark color, but less soft.

I don't think Dutch fonts are particularly dark, just Smeijers's.

BTW, when did Paperback come out?

hhp

Paperback was released ... hmm, 2 weeks ago ... I think.

My suggestion of Paperback was probably not correct at all. It isn't the same genre, but it strikes me as having some of the same friendliness and softness but in a stiff-upper-lip sort of way.

' [Aquila](http://web.archive.org/web/20150308211524/http:/www.dstype.com/)', _by Dino dos Santos, maybe_.?

_( Maybe take a look at the ' [Top 3 Serif Typefaces](http://web.archive.org/web/20150308211524/http:/typophile.com/node/12680)' thread, as well.. )_

For the archives: Saw [DTL Dorian](http://web.archive.org/web/20150308211524/http:/www.dutchtypelibrary.nl/) in the book [Neil Gaiman – Zerbrechliche Dinge](http://web.archive.org/web/20150308211524/http:/www.klett-cotta.de/fm/13/9783608938760.pdf) and thought it has some similarities to Dolly\*) – or is it vice versa?

\*) especially the italics.
